qas.question: From when was it taught that the little flock would not be the only people to survive Armageddon?
What was the number of the little flock set at?
Where would the great multitude live?
All new converts to the movmeent since 1935 were considered part of what class?
When was the start of the last days moved to in the mid-1930s?
In what year was Armageddon to occur according to Rutherford?
How many Jehovah's Witnesses were there as of 1935?
How many Jehovah's Witnesses had there been in 1914?
In what year did Rutherford die?

context: From <a0_0>1932<a0_0/>, it was taught that the "little flock" of <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>144,000<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/> would not be the only people to survive Armageddon. Rutherford explained that in addition to the 144,000 "anointed" who would be resurrected—or transferred at death—to live in heaven to rule over earth with Christ, a separate class of members, the "<a3_0>great multitude<a3_0/>," would live in <a2_0>a paradise restored on earth<a2_0/>; from <b5_0><b8_0>1935<b8_0/><b5_0/>, new converts to the movement were considered part of that class. By the mid-1930s, the timing of the beginning of Christ's presence (Greek: parousía), his enthronement as king, and the start of the "last days" were each moved to <a4_0>1914<a4_0/>.
